title: Support initializing new and existing directories
description: As a user, I want ainit to initialize both a new empty folder and an existing directory that already has code, so I can adopt the multi-agent workflow for any project.
acceptance_criteria: ainit <new-dir> creates the directory if it doesn't exist, then runs the interactive setup
ainit <existing-dir> detects language/framework from existing files (go.mod, package.json, pyproject.toml, etc.) and pre-fills defaults accordingly
ainit (no args) initializes the current directory, detecting existing code if present
Existing CLAUDE.md, workflow.md, backlog.json prompt for overwrite confirmation before replacing
If the target directory already has a backlog.json, warn and ask before overwriting to avoid data loss
Generated files are correct in both new-dir and existing-dir scenarios

tasks.title: Auto-create target directory if it doesn't exist
tasks.description: When the user passes a directory path that doesn't exist, create it (including parents) before proceeding with initialization.

tasks.title: Detect language from existing project files
tasks.description: Scan target directory for marker files: go.mod (Go), package.json (TypeScript/JS), pyproject.toml/setup.py/requirements.txt (Python). Use detection result to set the langKey for defaults.

tasks.title: Extract project metadata from existing files
tasks.description: Parse go.mod for module name, package.json for name/description/scripts, pyproject.toml for project name/description. Use extracted info to pre-fill prompt defaults (project name, description, build/test/lint commands).

tasks.title: Detect existing directory structure for DirStructure default
tasks.description: When initializing an existing directory, scan top-level subdirectories and generate a tree-like DirStructure default string instead of using the language template default.

tasks.title: Add overwrite confirmation for all generated files
tasks.description: Currently only CLAUDE.md has an overwrite check. Extend to workflow.md and backlog.json. For backlog.json, add a stronger warning since it may contain existing story data.

tasks.title: Add tests for new-dir and existing-dir scenarios
tasks.description: Write tests covering: (1) new directory creation, (2) language detection from marker files, (3) metadata extraction, (4) overwrite confirmation logic, (5) directory structure detection.

audit_log.detail: Created STORY-1 from user requirement: support initializing new folders and existing code directories.
